description: Triggers when users click on specific DOM elements, allowing you to track user interactions like button clicks, link clicks, form submissions, and other clickable element engagement.

when_to_use: Track button clicks and call-to-action (CTA) performance
Monitor link clicks and navigation patterns
Track form interactions and submission attempts
Measure user engagement with specific page elements
Implement event-driven analytics and conversion tracking
common_use_cases: CTA button tracking (Sign Up, Buy Now, Contact Us)
Navigation menu and footer link tracking
Social media button clicks (Share, Like, Follow)
Form field interactions and submission tracking
Video play button and interactive element tracking
best_practices: Use specific CSS selectors or XPath to target exact elements
Test selectors in browser developer tools before using
Prefer CSS selectors over XPath when possible for better performance
Use descriptive trigger names that indicate the element being tracked
Consider click frequency - avoid tracking elements clicked very frequently
Combine with page conditions when element exists on multiple pages

app_id.description: UUID of your Piwik PRO app

name.description: Descriptive name for the click trigger

update_trigger.description: Update an existing click trigger - only editable fields can be modified

app_id.description: UUID of your Piwik PRO app

trigger_id.description: UUID of the trigger to update

attributes.description: Trigger attributes to update (only editable fields will be processed)

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tag UUIDs to associate with this trigger
notes: If not provided, existing tag associations remain unchanged
If provided (even empty string), replaces ALL existing tag associations
Use empty string to remove all tag associations from the trigger

name.description: Human-readable trigger name that describes the click element or action
name.recommendation: Use descriptive names that clearly indicate which element or action is being tracked

trigger_type.edit_note: ‚ö†Ô∏è Cannot be changed after trigger creation

conditions.description: Array of condition objects that define when the click trigger should fire

condition_id.description: Unique identifier for this condition (auto-generated during trigger creation)

variable_id.description: UUID of the variable to check (typically Click Element or Click URL)

common_variables.click_element: CSS selector or XPath of the clicked element
common_variables.click_url: URL of the clicked link (for <a> tags)
common_variables.click_id: ID attribute of the clicked element
common_variables.click_classes: CSS classes of the clicked element

condition_type.description: Type of comparison to perform on the clicked element

value.description: Value to compare against (CSS selector, XPath, URL, etc.)

selector_type.description: Type of selector used in the value field

conditions.recommendation: Include at least one element selector condition to specify which clicks to track. All conditions are evaluated with logical AND; OR groupings are not supported. Use regex in a single condition if you need OR-like matching.

css_selector_targeting.description: Target elements using CSS selectors (recommended approach)

xpath_targeting.description: Target elements using XPath (for complex selections)

url_link_tracking.description: Track clicks on links to specific URLs

element_hierarchy.description: Track clicks on elements within specific containers

cta_button_tracking.use_case: Conversion rate optimization, button performance analysis

download_link_tracking.description: Track all PDF download link clicks
download_link_tracking.use_case: Content engagement tracking, resource download analytics

social_share_tracking.description: Track social media share button clicks
social_share_tracking.use_case: Social engagement tracking, viral content analysis

external_link_tracking.use_case: Outbound link tracking, partnership link performance

form_submit_tracking.use_case: Form conversion tracking, lead generation analysis

update_trigger_name.description: Update only the name of an existing trigger
update_trigger_name.use_case: Renaming triggers for better organization without changing conditions
update_trigger_name.explanation: Only the name is updated while all conditions and other settings remain unchanged

update_trigger_conditions.description: Update trigger conditions to track different elements
update_trigger_conditions.use_case: Modifying which elements trigger the event after website changes
update_trigger_conditions.explanation: Both name and conditions are updated simultaneously, creating new condition IDs for the updated conditions

common_mistakes: Using 'equals' condition type with Click Element variables (use 'matches' instead)
Using incorrect or overly complex CSS selectors that don't match elements
Forgetting to set selector_type in options when using XPath
Using selectors that match too many elements (causing excessive firing)
Not testing selectors in browser developer tools before implementing
Using fragile selectors that break when page structure changes
Tracking clicks on dynamically loaded content without proper selectors
Mixing CSS and XPath syntax in the same selector
Using invalid variable_id references for click-related variables

condition_variable_compatibility_error.error_message: Given condition (type: equals) could not be related with variable (name: Click Element)
condition_variable_compatibility_error.cause: Using incompatible condition type with Click Element variable
condition_variable_compatibility_error.solution: Use 'matches' instead of 'equals' for Click Element variables

possible_causes: CSS selector or XPath doesn't match the actual element
selector_type in options doesn't match the selector format used
Element is loaded dynamically after page load
Variable ID is incorrect or doesn't exist
Element exists but is not clickable (e.g., has pointer-events: none)
debugging_steps: Test the selector in browser developer tools console
Verify the element exists when the page loads completely
Check if selector_type in options matches your selector format
Use browser inspector to copy the exact selector
Test with simpler, more general selectors first
Verify the variable exists using list_variables() tool

possible_causes: Selector is too broad and matches multiple elements
Element is being clicked multiple times rapidly
Selector matches parent elements that bubble click events
Dynamic content creates multiple matching elements
solutions: Use more specific selectors (IDs instead of classes)
Add additional conditions to narrow the scope
Use descendant selectors to target specific instances
Add page-specific conditions to limit trigger scope
Consider click frequency and user behavior patterns

performance_considerations: Prefer CSS selectors over XPath for better performance
Use specific selectors to avoid unnecessary element matching
Avoid overly complex selectors with many conditions
Test selectors on pages with many elements
maintainability: Use semantic selectors that reflect element purpose
Document complex selectors with comments in trigger names
Coordinate with developers on stable selector strategies
Regular review and testing when page structure changes

click_element.description: CSS selector or XPath of the clicked element

click_url.description: href attribute of clicked links (<a> tags)
click_url.best_for: Link tracking, external link monitoring, download tracking

click_id.description: ID attribute of the clicked element
click_id.best_for: ID-based tracking when elements have stable IDs

click_classes.description: CSS class names of the clicked element

getting_variable_ids.step_1: Use list_variables() to see all available variables in your app
getting_variable_ids.step_2: Look for click-related variables (Click Element, Click URL, etc.)
getting_variable_ids.step_3: Copy the 'id' field from the variable object
getting_variable_ids.step_4: Use that UUID as the variable_id in your trigger conditions

conditional_clicking.description: Track clicks only on specific pages or under certain conditions
conditional_clicking.example: Track CTA clicks only on product pages
conditional_clicking.implementation: Combine click conditions with page URL conditions

click_sequence_tracking.description: Track specific click sequences or user flows
click_sequence_tracking.example: Track users who click 'Add to Cart' then 'Checkout'
click_sequence_tracking.implementation: Use multiple triggers with session-based variables

dynamic_content_tracking.description: Track clicks on dynamically loaded content
dynamic_content_tracking.challenges: Elements may not exist when trigger is evaluated
dynamic_content_tracking.solutions: Use broader selectors or event delegation patterns
